meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'spitty': characterized by spitting or producing saliva
meanings.sent1: The dog's behavior became spittier when it saw the mailman approaching.
meanings.sent2: She found the soup too spittier for her taste.
meanings.sent3: The spittier fountain in the park made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: The spittier raindrops seemed to dance on the pavement.
meanings.sent5: The spittier taste of the medicine made her grimace.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'spit': to forcefully eject saliva from the mouth
meanings.sent1: He accidentally spittiered while talking excitedly about his favorite movie.
meanings.sent2: Please do not spittier on the sidewalk; it's not polite.
meanings.sent3: The llama seemed to spittier at the most unexpected moments.
meanings.sent4: The angry cat spittiered furiously at the approaching dog.
meanings.sent5: The baseball player spittiered out the sunflower seed shells during the game.
